tags.description: Fitzgerald Memorial Field is a 3.11-acre iconic youth baseball diamond, located on the western bank of the Grand River, in the heart of downtown. Dedicated in 1936, the lighted and irrigated field now hosts the Mustang League baseball games (ages 9/10).
tags.name: Fitzgerald Memorial Field

tags.description: Island Park offers 2.25-acres of beautiful views of the Grand River situated in the heart of downtown Grand Ledge. The island is connected to the mainland by a wide pedestrian bridge, a perfect place to stop and watch the wildlife and take in the splendor
tags.name: Island Park

tags.description: Oak Park is located on a northerly bluff overlooking the Grand River, offering 8.98 acres of quiet park space. A recent expansion of the park nearly doubled the size of the park which now offers nearly 1,180 feet of riverfront.
tags.name: Oak Park

tags.description: Riverfront Park is a quaint 0.21-acre park offering incredible views of downtown Grand Ledge and the Grand River. The park is easily accessible by connected sidewalks and provides a beautifully landscaped parking area for visitors.
tags.name: Riverfront Park

tags.description: City Hall Park is a popular neighborhood park located behind City Hall.
tags.name: City Hall Park

tags.description: Oakwood Greenspace is a 2.2-acre open area located on the northeast side of Grand Ledge, adjacent to Oakwood Cemetery. This public space offers opportunities for visitors to create their own fun with recreational activities such as playing frisbee, kickba
tags.name: Oakwood Greenspace

tags.description: "Little Fitz" is one of the City's newest parks with over 7-acres of pristine, natural greenspace. This park has rustic trails and iconic sandstone ledges along the northern border of Sandstone Creek and the eastern border of the Grand River. "Little Fitz
tags.name: Little Fitz Park
Fitzergald Park
tags.note: Fitzgerald Park is owned by the City of Grand Ledge and leased to Eaton County for operations.
